alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 6:09PM EDT until September 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 PM EDT, Doppler radar was depicting extensive tropical rainfall poised to move west and continue to overspread the region though mid-evening. Locally as much as 3 inches of rain may accumulate, leading to elevated stream levels, developing high water conditions and flooding of low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincolnton, Maiden, Westport, Belwood, High Shoals, Boger City, Iron Station, Denver, Lake Norman, Lowesville, Crouse and Vale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Remember to be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding!
